thread.title: 8 things we learned from the fourth episode of Hunted
thread.title_full: 8 things we learned from the fourth episode of Hunted

title: 8 things we learned from the fourth episode of Hunted
text:
8 things we learned from the fourth episode of Hunted 8 things we learned from the fourth episode of Hunted 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
We are now four episodes into the Channel 4 series Hunted and contestants continue to drop like flies. 
Newcomer Adam Young was given a baptism of fire, zig-zagging up and down the country before he was eventually caught getting off a coach. 
Friends Lauren and Emily remained at large after separating from each other last week, with Stephen and Martin surviving an early scare to also remain untracked in the wilderness. Caught: Adam did not survive his first episode on the show (Colin Hutton/Channel 4) 
The Hunters were tweeting throughout the show, letting the fugitives know they were never far behind. Some advice for you, Stephen and Martin. Keep a low profile. I'm everywhere. #Hunted pic.twitter.com/HKiSJ1klTg 
— Hunted HQ (@Hunted_HQ) October 1, 2015 
Here is what we learned from week four of Hunted. 
1. A single sheep is called a sheep What do you call a lone sheep (Gareth Fuller/PA) 
Walsall lads Stephen and Martin started the show with an impressive display of rural ignorance, when Stephen asked his companion what a single sheep is called. 
It confused us too. 
— The Creative Medium (@FrijjMagnate) October 1, 2015 Sheep ffs….. sheep! #Hunted 
— Anne-Marie Evans (@AnnemarieEvans) October 1, 2015 On the run from @Hunted_HQ . Doesn't know what a single sheep is called. We're giving him 30 minutes, tops… #Hunted 
— Channel 4 (@Channel4) October 1, 2015 
2. You don’t need money when you have skills Despite his poor countryside knowledge, Stephen is a reliable plumber (Colin Hutton/Channel 4) 
Stephen and Martin showed their initiative, however, by securing a pair of bicycles for free, in exchange for a quick bit of plumbing work. Fixed his tap, and got free bikes. That's the way to do it. #hunted
